metadata.name: Image to SQLite and Back
metadata.description: Store a base64 image in SQLite as BLOB, read it back, and display it in the Image Viewer.

python_image_input.title: Fetch Pedantic2 PNG
python_image_input.code: import base64, requests; URL = 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/williamrhancock/Pedantic2/main/docs/Pedantic2-main.png'; def run(input): resp = requests.get(URL, timeout=10); resp.raise_for_status(); image_bytes = resp.content; data_uri = 'data:image/png;base64,' + base64.b64encode(image_bytes).decode('utf-8'); return {'filename': 'Pedantic2-main.png', 'image_data': data_uri, 'mime_type': 'image/png'}

config.query: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS images (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT, filename TEXT, mime_type TEXT, data BLOB, created_at TEXT);

python_prepare_insert.title: Prepare Image BLOB
python_prepare_insert.code: import base64, datetime; def run(input): data_uri = input.get('image_data', ''); assert data_uri and data_uri.startswith('data:image/'), 'image_data must be a data URI like data:image/png;base64,...'; header, b64 = data_uri.split(',', 1); mime_type = header.split(';')[0].split(':')[1]; image_bytes = base64.b64decode(b64); return {'filename': input.get('filename', 'image.png'), 'mime_type': mime_type, 'image_bytes': image_bytes, 'created_at': datetime.datetime.utcnow().isoformat()}

config.query: INSERT INTO images (filename, mime_type, data, created_at) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?);
SELECT id, filename, mime_type, data FROM images ORDER BY id DESC LIMIT 1;

python_to_data_uri.title: Convert BLOB to Data URI
python_to_data_uri.code: import base64; def run(input): rows = input.get('data', []); assert rows, 'No image rows found in database'; row = rows[0]; mime = row.get('mime_type', 'image/png'); blob = row.get('data'); b64 = base64.b64encode(blob).decode('utf-8'); data_uri = f'data:{mime};base64,{b64}'; return {'image_data': data_uri, 'filename': row.get('filename'), 'id': row.get('id')}
